CatDescriptText: Donald Rothhaar, branch manager industrial sales concern, Castle Shannon and Geraldine Chavez, Sharpsburg, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, February 20, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe in the old-fashioned "woodshed" reprimand or the "talking things over with the offender" type of discipline as regards the correction of youngsters guilty of misdemeanors?" Mr. Rothhaar's answer reads: "Talking things over leads to a better understanding and also will enable the child to go farther in life."  Ms. Chavez's answer reads: "Talking it over is better.  It leads to better understanding and more respect."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Donald Rothhaar wearing hat with woven band, striped tie, and light colored torn v-neck sweater, standing in front of ribbed metal wall, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Geraldine Chavez wearing dark knitted gloves, head scarf, and dark overcoat, holding documents, standing in front of woman and ribbed metal wall, Smithfield Street, Downtown
